property.name: text
property.value: POST request: Return true/false success status and info message Also, if successful, send mail to dopresence@embedded.eecs.berkeley.edu Perform case-insensitive check, since iPad auto-capitalizes first letter

property.name: text
property.value:
Email: Create file containing password at: $HOME/.DOPMailPassword.txt The email password can be found on the DOP Presence wiki page.
IMPORTANT! Right click on SendMail actor -> check "reallySendMail" Check your SPAM folder for mail
enableSSL is checked, as both Berkeley mail and Gmail require this. Berkeley SMTP info: https://calmail.berkeley.edu/docs/client.html
Gmail SMTP info: http://email.about.com/od/accessinggmail/f/Gmail_SMTP_Settings.htm

property.name: text
property.value: Model enableBackwardTypeInference false here, due to DatabaseSelect

property.name: text
property.value:
Database: Create file containing password at: $HOME/cat .databasePassword.txt Username and password can be found on the DOP presence wiki page.
See also: http://embedded.eecs.berkeley.edu/dopresence/wiki/Main/PtolemyModel

property.name: text
property.value:
This model probably won't run from off the UC Berkeley campus because port 3306 is blocked.
Also, the password for the database would be needed.

property.name: text
property.value:
This model launches a web server and provides a service available at http://localhost:8078/dop
The service accepts a username and door code, checks a database, and triggers a door unlock and an email for valid username / door code combinations.
Please run the model and navigate to the URL, or run the model and double-click on this comment

property.name: text
property.value: WebServer.preferredPort blank for dynamic port selection Find deployed port number for header comment link Force evaluation on model start

entity.name: FileReader
entity.doc: Read an entire file and output as a string

entity.name: StringFunction
entity.doc: Trim a string, convert a string to uppercase, or convert a string to lowercase depending on the user's selection.

property.name: text
property.value: RecordAssembler2: Make sure both username and doorcode are set before querying db

property.name: query
property.value: select realname from doorcodes where username='$username' and doorCode='$doorCode'

entity.name: StringReplace
entity.doc: Replace the patterns that match a regular expression

property.name: text
property.value: TODO: Would like to use realname here. But, run-time type checking problem.

property.name: message
property.value: Christopher Brooks entered the DOP Center using a door code.

entity.name: FileReader
entity.doc: Read an entire file and output as a string

entity.name: StringFunction
entity.doc: Trim a string, convert a string to uppercase, or convert a string to lowercase depending on the user's selection.

property.name: expression
property.value: username + " entered the DOP Center using a door code."

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value
